Question
========

A student did not prepare for a true-false test that contains 20 questions. Therefore, he guesses at each question. At 70% correct answers he passes. Suppose *X* is the number of questions to which he gives the correct answer. The probability of that student passing this test can be written as:

Answerlist
----------

* P(X = 70%)
* P(X ≥ 30%)
* P(X ≥ 70%)
* P(X ≥ 14)
* P(X > 15)

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* P(X = 70%): Incorrect
* P(X ≥ 30%): Incorrect
* P(X ≥ 70%): Incorrect
* P(X ≥ 14): Correct
* P(X > 15): Incorrect
